meta.name: viewport
meta.title: IPS Home Learning Plan - Indianapolis Public Schools

meta.name: description
meta.content: Per the State of Indiana, closures will last through the end of this school year. Students will complete the year using the district’s Home Learning Plan.
IPS Home Learning Plan - Indianapolis Public Schools
Per the State of Indiana, closures will last through the end of this school year. Students will complete the year using the district’s Home Learning Plan.

a.span: Emma Donnan, T.C. Howe and Emmerich Manual Process Update

li.a: Textbook and Other Educational Benefits Assistance

div.class: kt-row-column-wrap kt-has-2-columns kt-gutter-default kt-v-gutter-default kt-row-valign-top kt-row-layout-equal kt-tab-layout-row kt-m-colapse-right-to-left kt-mobile-layout-row kt-custom-first-width-75 kt-custom-second-width-25

div.p: Per the State of Indiana, closures will last through the end of this school year. Students will complete the year using the district’s Home Learning Plan.

Even though students won’t be in physical classrooms, principals, teachers and all school-based staff are excited and ready to work with students within the home-based models. As always, parents/guardians are key players in motivating and encouraging students to complete their assigned coursework in a timely manner. Together, we can keep our students on track toward graduation and a bright future.

div.class: kt-row-column-wrap kt-has-2-columns kt-gutter-skinny kt-v-gutter-default kt-row-valign-top kt-row-layout-equal kt-tab-layout-row kt-m-colapse-left-to-right kt-mobile-layout-row kt-custom-first-width-50 kt-custom-second-width-50

div.p: Our primary goal is to provide continuity of education for our K–8 students via a paper/pencil packet learning pathway. Below are activities that engage students in learning and play without overwhelming families.

div.class: kt-accordion-wrap kt-accordion-wrap kt-accordion-id_0bdad3-12 kt-accordion-has-12-panes kt-active-pane-0 kt-accordion-block kt-pane-header-alignment-left kt-accodion-icon-style-basic kt-accodion-icon-side-right

kb-blocks-advanced-slider-init kb-slider-loading kb-blocks-slider kt-carousel-arrowstyle-whiteondark kt-carousel-dotstyle-dark kb-slider-size-ratio kb-slider-ratio-16-9 kb-slider-tab-ratio-inherit kb-slider-mobile-ratio-inherit

figure.class: wp-block-embed-youtube wp-block-embed is-type-video is-provider-youtube wp-embed-aspect-16-9 wp-has-aspect-ratio
wp-block-embed-youtube wp-block-embed is-type-video is-provider-youtube wp-embed-aspect-16-9 wp-has-aspect-ratio

span.span: Learn more about the K–8 IPS Home Learning Plan in the following documents

ul.li: Home Learning Plan Guidance for Grade K-8 Students & Families | Guía del plan de aprendizaje en el hogar para estudiantes y familias de grados K-8
Home Learning Plan FAQs for Grade K-8 Students & Families | Preguntas frecuentes sobre el plan de aprendizaje en el hogar para estudiantes y familias de grados K-8

li.strong: Weekly Academic K-8 Plans for April

em.em: The documents below have been mailed to all K-8 families. If you have not received a packet as of April 8, please download the documents or call the IPS Service Center at 317.226.4000. Questions can also be directed to your child’s teacher.

div.p: K–8 packets for the month of April are also available at IPS Meal Service locations on Mondays and Wednesdays. Click here for the times and locations.

If you and your child need support, please call the Stand for Children Indiana Home Learning Hotline at 317.560.4600. Zoom video support will be an option for families who have the available technology. Support is available:

ul.li: Tuesday and Thursday: 4 p.m. to 6 p.m.

div.class: kt-row-column-wrap kt-has-2-columns kt-gutter-skinny kt-v-gutter-default kt-row-valign-top kt-row-layout-equal kt-tab-layout-row kt-m-colapse-right-to-left kt-mobile-layout-row kt-custom-first-width-50 kt-custom-second-width-50

div.p: The Home Learning Plan utilizes an e-learning platform that allows high school students to access resources and materials, but also get the instruction, feedback and conversation that are critical for sustained learning. Through this plan, your child has the opportunity to stay on track to graduate by completing their current coursework to earn credits toward graduation.

div.class: kt-accordion-wrap kt-accordion-wrap kt-accordion-id_72f92a-ec kt-accordion-has-11-panes kt-active-pane-0 kt-accordion-block kt-pane-header-alignment-left kt-accodion-icon-style-basic kt-accodion-icon-side-right

span.span: Learn more about the high school (Grades 9–12) IPS Home Learning Plan in the following documents

ul.li: Home Learning Plan Guidance for Grade 9–12 Students & Families | Orientación del plan de aprendizaje en el hogar para estudiantes y familias de grados 9–12
Home Learning Plan FAQs for Grade 9–12 Students & Families | Preguntas frecuentes sobre el plan de aprendizaje en el hogar para estudiantes y familias de grados 9–12

div.p: If you and your child need support, please call the Stand for Children Indiana Home Learning Hotline at 317.560.4600. Zoom video support will be an option for families who have the available technology. Support is available:

ul.li: Tuesday and Thursday: 4 p.m. to 6 p.m.

em.strong: If you have questions about the IPS Home Learning Plan or need assistance with Schoology or Clever, please contact the IPS Help Desk at 317.226.3600. Questions can also be directed to your teacher.

div.h2: Need help on academic work? Call the Stand for Children Indiana Home Learning Hotline at 317.560.4600.

div.class: kt-row-column-wrap kt-has-2-columns kt-gutter-default kt-v-gutter-default kt-row-valign-top kt-row-layout-equal kt-tab-layout-row kt-m-colapse-left-to-right kt-mobile-layout-row

strong.strong: Social and Emotional Lessons (SEL) for Grades K-12

div.p: We know this is a stressful time for students and families, and IPS is here to support you, not just academically, but socially and emotionally.

The district’s SEL team has compiled weekly videos lessons and daily activities to help children and teens within each grade level. Each week, students can watch the lesson, practice skills, and include the entire family in activities. There are also tips and tasks for students and families throughout the day to help reduce stress and anxiety.

div.class: kt-accordion-wrap kt-accordion-wrap kt-accordion-id_e22c4a-27 kt-accordion-has-12-panes kt-active-pane-0 kt-accordion-block kt-pane-header-alignment-left kt-accodion-icon-style-basic kt-accodion-icon-side-right

span.span: Learn more about the SEL activities and resources in the following documents. Please note that these lessons and activities are not required, but offered as an assistance to your families

noscript.div:
To view the Google Drive folders, you need to have JavaScript enabled in your browser.
To do so, please follow these instructions.

div.class: kt-row-column-wrap kt-has-2-columns kt-gutter-skinny kt-v-gutter-default kt-row-valign-top kt-row-layout-equal kt-tab-layout-row kt-m-colapse-right-to-left kt-mobile-layout-row kt-custom-first-width-50 kt-custom-second-width-50

div.p: Just like our K-12 students, preschoolers need to stay active and keep learning while at home. The IPS Early Learning team has developed guidance for parents and families in daily home learning activities below. Using what can be found in most homes, parents can engage their child throughout the week. From ABC hunts to sorting/counting to learning how to help with home tasks and more – little ones will have fun while learning the basics to prepare them for kindergarten and beyond.
